title: .meteorrc
description: Defines the format and gives available options for configuring the MeteorShowerIdentificationConsole app.

file.description: Sets the file path. Supports both relative and absolute paths.

columns.title: Specifies which data are in which columns in the input file
columns.description: The input files are expected to be white-space-aligned columns. They can but are not required to include a header row. When header row is present, use the names of columns, otherwise use column indices (starting with 0).

criteria.title: List of used D-criteria
criteria.description: Selects the criteria. Omit to use all criteria. This is the master selection, you can keep the limits for unused criteria and they will remain unused.

progradeLimits.title: Limits for the D-criterion
progradeLimits.description: Sets the criterion cutoffs. `ecliptic` is for i<10° and `middle` for 10°<=i<90°.

fullLimits.title: Limits for the D-criterion
fullLimits.description: Sets the criterion cutoffs. `ecliptic` is for i<10°, `middle` for 10°<=i<90° and `retrograde` for i>=90°.

criteria.title: D-criteria used in comparisons
criteria.description: Selects the criteria and sets the cutoff limits which will be used when comparing orbits. Leave empty for all criteria with default cutoffs.

limits.title: Limits for the D-criteria
limits.description: Sets the cutoff limits for individual criteria. Unspecified criteria will use default cutoffs.

oneOf.description: Defines an orbit using semi-major axis length `a`.
Defines and orbit using perihelion distance `q`.

reference.title: The reference input file
reference.description: Specify the file of known meteor stream orbits or use `default` for the built-in list of streams.

threads.title: Number of child threads to run concurrently
threads.description: The D-criteria calculations are run in multiple threads to speed up processing. The main thread handles only visuals. This option modifies the number of threads to run calculations on.

load.title: Number of orbits to load at once
load.description: Orbits from the compared file are loaded in block of this size. This makes the processing memory-stable, but slightly slows down processing. Increase this number to load more orbits into memory at once, or decrease this number to use less memory.
